com.whirvis.jraknet.client

Class MaximumTransferUnit

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.whirvis.jraknet.client.MaximumTransferUnit

  • public final class MaximumTransferUnit
extends java.lang.Object
    Used by the RakNetClient and PeerFactory during connection to track how and when they should modify their maximum transfer unit.
    Since:
    JRakNet v2.0.0
    Author:
    Whirvis T. Wheatley

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int retries 
      private int retriesLeft 
      private int size 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MaximumTransferUnit(int size, int retries)
      Creates a maximum transfer unit.

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object o) 
      int getRetries()
      Returns the default amount of retries before the client stops using this maximum transfer unit size and uses the next lowest one.
      int getRetriesLeft()
      Returns the amount of times retry() can be called before reset() needs to be called.

      Returns the size of the maximum transfer unit in bytes.

    • Field Detail

      • size

        private final int size

    • Constructor Detail

      • MaximumTransferUnit

        public MaximumTransferUnit(int size,
                           int retries)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a maximum transfer unit.
        Parameters:
        size - the size of the maximum transfer unit in bytes.
        retries - the amount of time the client should try to use it before going to the next lowest maximum transfer unit size.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the size is less than or equal to 0, if the size odd (not divisible by 2), or the retry count is less than or equal to 0.

    • Method Detail

      • sort

        public static MaximumTransferUnit[] sort(MaximumTransferUnit... units)
                                  throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Sorts an array of maximum transfer units from the highest to lowest maximum transfer units based on their maximum transfer unit size.
        Parameters:
        units - the maximum transfer units to sort.
        Returns:
        the sorted maximum transfer units.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the units are null or if any of the maximum transfer units inside of the unit are null.

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Returns the size of the maximum transfer unit in bytes.
        Returns:
        the size of the maximum transfer unit in bytes.

      • getRetries

        public int getRetries()
        Returns the default amount of retries before the client stops using this maximum transfer unit size and uses the next lowest one.
        Returns:
        the default amount of retries before the client stops using this maximum transfer unit size and uses the next lowest one.

      • getRetriesLeft

        public int getRetriesLeft()
        Returns the amount of times retry() can be called before reset() needs to be called. If this is 0, then calling the retry() method will yield a IllegalStateException.
        Returns:
        the amount of times retry() can be called before reset() needs to be called.

      • retry

        public int retry()
          throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Lowers the amount of retries left.
        Returns:
        the amount of retries left.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the amount of retries left is than or equal to 0.
        See Also:
        reset()

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Sets the amount of retries left back to the default.

        This is necessary in order to be able to reuse a maximum transfer unit once it has been depleted of its retries left.

        See Also:
        retry()

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object
